1.q_string: A charged sphere of diameter 4 cm has a charge density of 10<sup>-4</sup> coulomb/cm<sup>2</sup>. What is the work done (in joules) when a charge of 40 nanocoulombs is moved from infinity to a point which is at a distance of 2 cm from the surface of the sphere?

A charged particle q moving with speed v is shot towards another charged particle Q, which is held stationary. It approaches Q up to a closest distance r and then returns. If q was given a speed of 2v, what will be the closest distance approached by this charge?

Two point charges -q and +q are located at points (0, 0, - a) and (0, 0, a), respectively. What is the electric potential at point (0, 0, z)?
